Watching John Cassavetes film, Opening Night, I was reminded of something that Quentin Tarantino said once in an interview about personal experience in being a creator. He said:
“I don’t think there’s any such thing as this has happened to me; therefore, I should film this. It’s more about what do you get out of living the life that is accessible? And then just translate your desires into it”. I returned to my desk with renewed verve.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on his friendship with fellow artist Yukito Sato, plus his love for Misago Okamoto (the one he never married), this is the story of how a mediocre student discovered himself through art. As such there are juxtapositions between youth dreams and business realities that abound in this movie.
